greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array read by antidiagonals downwards: T(n,k) = (n*k)!/(k!^n*n!), (n>=1, k>=1), the number of ways of dividing nk labeled items into n unlabeled boxes with k items in each box.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Antidiagonals n = 1..50, flattened (first 20 antidiagonals from Harry J. Smith)
formula: T(n,k) = Product_{j=2,n} C(j*k-1,k-1). - _M. F. Hasler_, Aug 22 2014
mathematica: Table[T[n-k+1, k], {n, 1, 10}, {k, n, 1, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 29 2018 *)
program: (PARI) { i=0; for (m=1, 20, for (n=1, m, k=m - n + 1; write("b060540.txt", i++, " ", (n*k)!/(k!^n*n!))); ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 06 2009
xref: Related to A057599, see also A096126 and A246048.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 02 2001
ext: Definition reworded by _M. F. Hasler_, Aug 23 2014
